description.en:
The participants are expected to be at CEF B2 level and have intermediate digital competencies (see  https://publications.jrc.ec.europa.eu/repository/bitstream/JRC106281/web-digcomp2.1pdf_(online).pdf). Before the course starts, students need to sit the placement test on the course's Moodle page to see whether the course is suitable for them.

During the course students develop their critical reading and thinking skills by reading/listening to different texts (extracts of academic texts, articles, essays, academic lectures, presentations, interviews, dialogues), do grammar/vocabulary exercises, sit progress quizzes, participate in online discussions, and make short presentations. A variety of extra tasks is offered, so students can diverge from the core content to meet their more specific needs. The topics covered in the autumn term are multiple intelligences/learning styles, the brain, culture and things that make humans different from animals. The study group can put together their grammar curriculum. The course ends with the end-term test and a video presentation. Compulsory independent work, quizzes and message board discussions are the prerequisites to the end-term test.

Course requirements
1. active participation in the course (doing web practices and home assignments, sitting quizzes and discussing on message boards)
2. meeting the deadlines of all independent work
3. 65% of possible points in the end-term test
4. an oral presentation on a set topic
description.et:
Kursusest osavõtjatelt eeldatakse CEF B2 (upper-intermediate) keeleoskustaset ja digikompetentsi kesktasemel  (vt https://publications.jrc.ec.europa.eu/repository/bitstream/JRC106281/web-digcomp2.1pdf_(online).pdf). Enne kursuse algust tuleb kursuse Moodle-lehel teha diagnostiline test ning seejärel otsustada, kas kursus on jõukohane.


Kursuse jooksul arendavad üliõpilased oma kriitilise lugemise ja mõtlemise oskusi erineva suunitlusega suulisi/kirjalikke tekste (lõigud akadeemilistest tekstidest/loengutest, artikid, esseed, intervjuud, dialoogid) lugedes. Nad teevad sõnavara/grammatikaharjutusi, enesekontrolliteste, osalevad online-diskussioonides ja teevad lühikesi online-ettkandeid. Üliõpilastele pakutakse erinevaid lisaülesandeid, mis võimaldavad neil oma nõrkade külgedega tegeleda. Sügisemestri teemadeks on mitmikintellikents/õpistiilid, aju, kultuur ning asjad, mis eristavad inimesi loomadest. Õppegrupp valib läbitavad grammatikateemad etteantutest ise. Kohustuslik iseseisev töö, enesekontrollitestid ja foorumiarutelud on lõpphindamisele pääsemise eeltingimusteks. 

Läbimise tingimused:
1. aktiivne osalemine kursusel (online-diskussioonid ja - ettekanded, iseseisev töö, enesekontrollitestid)
2. tähtaegadest kinnipidamine
3. lõputesti positiivne sooritamine (65% punktidest)
4. ettekande tegemine

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to develop general vocabulary and communication skills via online presentations, online discussions and reading/listening different texts, and consolidate some advanced language structures at B2-C1 level.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on B2-C1 tasemel suurendada sõnavara mahtu, parendada online-ettekannete, -diskussioonide ja erineva suunitlusega suuliste/kirjalike tekstide abil kommunikatiivseid oskusi ning konsolideerida teatud keelestruktuure.

learning_outcomes.en: On successful completion of the course the students
1. will have practiced different vocabulary learning strategies;
learning_outcomes.et: 1. on harjutanud erinevaid sõnavara õppimise strateegiaid;

learning_outcomes.en: 2. know how to use some advanced language structures more successfully;
3. are able to analyse academic oral/written texts on the language and text level;
learning_outcomes.et: 3. oskab sõnavara ja teksti tasmemel analüüsida ingliskeelse akadeemilise suunitlusega suulist/kirjalikku teksti;

learning_outcomes.en: 4. will have experienced making a video presentation
learning_outcomes.et: 4. teab, kuidas valmistada ja kanda ette lühike videoettekanne (~5 minutit).

notes.et: Course policies 1. By registering for this course you agree with the course requirements and policies. 2. Please note the deadline for dropping the course. If you want to drop the course after the deadline, you need to contact the study coordinator (marilii.adamson (at) ut.ee). 3. You are expected to maintain the highest standards of academic integrity. Academic misconduct (copying text/sentences or using LLM output and presenting it as one's own, not using paraphrasing, not crediting the sources) will be penalised according to the university's regulations. 4. All study debts need to be settled by Jan 15, 2023. 5. You can sit the end-term test thrice. 6. This is not a grammar/writing/conversation course. 7. This course does not prepare students for proficiency examination. 8. This course is non-graded (pass/fail). 9. Failing to meet deadlines constantly results in failing the course. If you need extension, let me know in advance! 10. I do not give feedback to overdue written tasks. 11. In case of any problems, contact me right away to find a solution.

independent_work.et:
Weekly worksheets: do necessary tasks, fill in worksheets and upload them to assignment tools
Progress quizzes: do online practice classes/read materials and sit quizzes
Informal talk: prepare the talk (detailed instructions in Moodle), record yourself using tools/software suggested by the instructor and upload the talk
Vocabulary notebook: keep a vocabulary notebook (detailed instructions in Moodle)

description.et: Weekly worksheets (due dates in Moodle), progress quizzes (due dates in Moodle), informal talks and online discussions (pass/fail) are the prerequisites to the final grammar quiz and the vocabulary notebook.
The end-term grammar test and the vocabulary notebook.

grade_preconditions.et: The weekly worksheets, progress quizzes, and the talk are the prerequisites to the final grammar test/submission of the vocabulary notebook. You need to gather 71 points to get a positive result for the course. See the point breakdown in Moodle.

grade_evaluation.et: If you have fulfilled all the course requirements by December 12, 2022, you get your result automatically.

debt_elimination.et: Weekly worksheets, grammar quizzes, online discussions and presentations are the prerequisites to the end-term test. The end-term test can be taken twice. All study debts need to be settled by January 15, 2022.

resources.mandatory_materials: Study materials are uploaded to Moodle.
